title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 November 2015 - XWiki
content:
<cjd> has quit  
00:00 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:02 <cjd\_> is now known as <cjd>  
00:48 <vmassol> has quit  
00:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

08:41 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:47 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <msmeria> has quit  
09:59 <msmeria1> is now known as <msmeria>  
10:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> finishing fixing http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12834 this morning  
11:13 <vmassol> (actually http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12842 )  
11:16 <vmassol> (if my IDE lets me...)  
11:28 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:00 <cjd> I'm writing a little velocity to dump all extension IDs so I can find the popular ones, hope it doesn't bother anyone  
12:01 <vmassol> @caleb, I'd prefer if you could put this script in Admin space  
12:02 <vmassol> that's the right location and it's protected  
12:02 <vmassol> (@cjd)  
12:02 <cjd> ok  
12:02 <vmassol> you'll find lots of other scripts there  
12:02 <cjd> also if you start the message with 'cjd' it will highlight me  
12:02 <vmassol> I know  
12:02 <vmassol> hence the @cjd above :)  
12:03 <cjd> yeab but the @ and the ( make it not highlight  
12:03 <cjd> it has to really start with 'cjd'  
12:03 <vmassol> cjd: you should use a better tool! :)  
12:03 <vmassol> because @ is the most common IMO  
12:03 <vmassol> anyway  
12:03 <vmassol> I can't remember everyone's prefrences :)  
12:03 <cjd> if you type cj and then tab, does it tab-complete ?  
12:04 <vmassol> sure as for everyone else  
12:04 <vmassol> anywhere in a sentence  
12:04 <cjd> yeap  
12:04 <vmassol> I never type a user name, always use tab-complete, very handy  
12:04 <cjd> that's an unfortunatel missing feature in skype that you can't highlight people  
12:04 <vmassol> you can  
12:04 <vmassol> AFAIR  
12:05 <cjd> well my visible name has spaces so it would have to be like   @'Caleb James DeLisle' or something heh  
12:05 <vmassol> checking  
12:06 <vmassol> my bad, I thought I had seen some prefs for this but can't find them so it probably doesn't exist  
12:07 <vmassol> (for skype on mac)  
12:07 <vmassol> (there are plenty of other notifs but not this one apparently)  
12:07 <cjd> it's kind of related to the nickname system in IRC which other chat solutions did not copy  
12:07 <vmassol> all the others chat solution I use support this  
12:08 <cjd> If the person's name has spaces in it, it's not easy to notify them  
12:08 <cjd> Oh hey, off-topic... we need a "like" button on the extensions instead of 1-5 stars, people don't know what to do with stars  
12:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: you know the best solution to get the first space name when you have an EntityReference of type EntityType.SPACE?  
12:11 <vmassol> because removeParent() and then getRoot() is not very nice  
12:11 <tmortagne> I don't understand your question actually, do you have an example ?  
12:11 <vmassol> wiki:space1.space2  
12:12 <vmassol> you have this as an EntityRefernece of type SPACE  
12:12 <vmassol> I want space1  
12:12 <tmortagne> well getParent()  
12:12 <vmassol> nazh  
12:12 <vmassol> wiki:space1….spaceN.page  
12:12 <vmassol> I want space1  
12:13 <cjd> 384 extensions installable with the EM  
12:13 <vmassol> I was thinking about introducing a getFirstReference(EntityType type) or something like this  
12:13 <vmassol> (in EntityReference)  
12:13 <tmortagne> ok so you need some kind of extractLastReference  
12:13 <vmassol> cjd:  you have that info in XWiki directly btw  
12:13 <vmassol> extractFirstReference actually yes  
12:13 <cjd> yeah, but now I have the IDs :)  so I can pound elasticsearch for stats on them  
12:13 <tmortagne> last because the EntityReference start with page  
12:14 <vmassol> no  
12:14 <vmassol> we alrady have getLastSpaceReference  
12:14 <vmassol> so it would't be logical to change the order  
12:14 <tmortagne> it badly named actually  
12:14 <vmassol> depends  
12:14 <vmassol> for me it's correct  
12:14 <vmassol> the other around would be wrong  
12:14 <vmassol> because we write left to right  
12:14 <tmortagne> getLastSpaceReference return the first found SPACE reference so it's a pretty bad name from EntityReference point of view  
12:15 <vmassol> no  
12:15 <tmortagne> EntityReference is not a String  
12:15 <vmassol> it returns the last one  
12:15 <vmassol> doesn't change anything  
12:15 <vmassol> root is root  
12:15 <vmassol> it's not bottom  
12:15 <vmassol> you alwazys start with root  
12:16 <vmassol> our EntityRef isn't organized from bottom to root, it's organized from root to bottom  
12:16 <vmassol> anyway  
12:16 <vmassol> apart from the naming  
12:16 <vmassol> :)  
12:16 <vmassol> is there a better solution than removeParent followed by getRoot right now?  
12:16 <vmassol> actuallt a loop probably is as good  
12:17 <vmassol> will do a  loop even though it's a pain  
12:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: why don't you add a method ?  
12:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: you mean in my code or in EntityReference?  
12:34 <tmortagne> if there is a need and you are working on SNAPSHOT and not some extension I would add a new helper  
12:34 <tmortagne> sounds like a valid use case that would be in the API  
12:34 <vmassol> right now I've added this in my code: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/c2068be9ce7c53dbb27c  
12:34 <vmassol> but yes  
12:34 <tmortagne> s/would/could/  
12:34 <vmassol> I'd like it to be in EntityReference (or something like this)  
12:35 <vmassol> since it's a generic use case IMO  
12:35 <tmortagne> it's EntityReference job yes  
12:35 <vmassol> ok cool  
12:35 <vmassol> then I'll send a proposal on the list  
12:35 <vmassol> for the naming part  
12:35 <tmortagne> I guess because of getLastSpace we don't have much choice for the naming now  
12:36 <vmassol> I agree  
12:36 <vmassol> would be a pain to change it  
12:36 <vmassol> and as I said I can rationalize it  
12:36 <vmassol> the 2 naming are correct IMO  
12:36 <vmassol> it depends how you view it  
12:37 <tmortagne> most of the other EntityReference view things from the lowest element (it's not extractLastReference for example)  
12:37 <vmassol> it's just extractReference so it's neutral  
12:38 <vmassol> but should have been called extractLastreference IMO :)  
12:38 <tmortagne> neutral means give me the first one, like String.indexof  
12:38 <vmassol> what happened is that I started the API  
12:38 <vmassol> and my vision was left to right since I believe this is the easiest for users  
12:38 <vmassol> but then other decs have added apis  
12:38 <vmassol> \*devs  
12:39 <vmassol> and they may have not followed this vision  
12:57 <vmassol> guys  
12:58 <vmassol> question: is it normal that I don't see XWiki.XWikiPreferences in the AS (when I have show hidden docs) when I make a change the rights in the admin UI?  
12:58 <vmassol> we have some special handling for XWikiPreferences?  
13:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm not sure that extractReference() is correct: it returns the current entity if it doesn't find an entity matching the passed type. I'd have expected null because it means calling code may need to test the type of what's returned as a consequence..  
13:15 <vmassol> wdyt?  
13:19 <vmassol> tmortagne and others: let me know if http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12845 is ok for you  
13:20 <vmassol> (bbl lunch)  
13:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: it does not return this  
13:48 <tmortagne> it start with this and got from parent to parent until reference is null  
13:49 <tmortagne> so it will return null if it does not find anything  
13:49 <vmassol> ok good  
13:50 <tmortagne> s/got/go/  
13:50 <vmassol> fixing javadoc  
13:50 <vmassol> any comment regarding XWIKI-12845?  
13:50 <tmortagne> I don't understand what is wrong about the javadoc  
13:50 <tmortagne> it's not saying it will return this if it does not find anything  
13:51 <tmortagne> it's saying it mayb return this if this is of the asked type  
13:51 <vmassol> yes it doesn't say what it returns if the type is not found  
14:06 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <vmassol> committing  
14:08 <vmassol> I can always rollback if someone is not happy
